messages.content: Is there an AI tool that will look through my email and help me find warm contacts and assess the content to see who to reply to?

Below are the most common ways people solve this problem today, ordered from “relationship-intelligence CRMs” (designed to surface warm contacts) to lighter-weight email clients and plug-ins that focus on triage and reply assistance.  

---

### 1 | Relationship-intelligence CRMs  
These tools connect directly to Gmail or Outlook, ingest headers + metadata (optionally full bodies), and run their own scoring models to highlight who already knows you, how “warm” the thread is, and when to follow up.

| Product | How it finds warm contacts | Reply-help features | Typical audience / pricing |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Clay** | Measures recency + frequency across email, LinkedIn, calendar; shows “Relationship strength” meters and flags people you haven’t touched in X days. Also mines past threads & LinkedIn overlaps to propose warm introductions. citeturn1search9turn0search8 | One-click AI summaries before you open a thread, auto-generated follow-up drafts | Solo pros & small teams. Free tier, then ≈ €35 / mo for full AI pack |
| **Affinity** | Automatically captures every email and calendar event, deduplicates contacts, then scores the strongest mutual paths inside your firm (“Relationship Intelligence”). citeturn2search0turn2search4 | Shows who at your org knows the prospect best; Copilot-style recap + reply suggestions | Deal-makers (VC, BD). Starts ≈ €150 / seat / mo |
| **Folk CRM** | Lighter personal CRM—imports Gmail, tags warm leads, and its new **AI Follow-ups** view ranks contacts that are “likely to reply if you nudge them this week.” citeturn0search9 | Generates a personalized bump email in one click | Indie consultants & micro-teams; Free up to 100 contacts, then €18 / mo |

---

### 2 | AI-first email clients  
If you prefer to stay inside a normal mailbox but want AI to reshuffle it for you:

* **Superhuman AI** – “Split Inbox” auto-separates important threads, an **Engagement Score** highlights contacts that tend to respond quickly, and *Instant Reply* drafts context-aware answers. Now part of Grammarly, so deeper writing suggestions are coming. citeturn0search3turn0news69  
* **Microsoft Outlook + Copilot** – the new **“Prioritize my inbox”** view (rolling out June–Aug 2025) marks high-priority mails, shows a one-line reason (“from your manager,” “deadline tomorrow”), and can filter to “people you usually reply to.” citeturn3search2turn3search9  
* **Gmail + Gemini** – Gemini can already summarise long threads and draft context-aware replies via *Help Me Write*; it doesn’t score “warmth” yet, but many users pair it with Clay for that layer. citeturn0search4

---

### 3 | Plug-in assistants (cheapest / easiest to try)  

| Add-on | What it does well | Where it falls short |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Mailbutler Smart Assistant** | Detects tasks, generates short or formal replies, summarises long chains. Works in Apple Mail, Gmail, Outlook. citeturn4search0 | No warm-contact scoring (you’d still tag contacts manually) |
| **Canary Mail** | AI Focus Inbox builds a “Priority” list, offers instant summaries + quick replies even offline. citeturn4search4 | Limited CRM view; best for individual usage, not teams |

---

## Choosing the right path

1. **If “who’s warm?” is the main need** – start with **Clay’s free trial**; if you manage multi-party deals, test **Affinity**.  
2. **If you already live in Outlook or Gmail and just need triage + drafts** – Copilot (Outlook) or Gemini (Gmail) may be enough; layer Clay/Folk later if you miss relationship scores.  
3. **Budget / privacy constraints** – plug-ins like Mailbutler keep data local and cost < €10 / mo. All vendors use OAuth, but enterprise SOC 2 / GDPR docs vary—worth checking before granting full-mailbox access.

Feel free to tell me more about your current stack or budget and I can narrow this down further.
